title: Bardana
description: This document describes Bardana, also known as arctium majus or lappa, a plant from the Asteráceas family. It covers its appearance, active principles, pharmacological action, indications, toxicity, energetic aspects, and traditional uses.

title: Gayuba
description: This document describes the Gayuba plant, scientifically known as Arctostaphylos uva-ursi, and its medicinal properties. It covers its active ingredients, pharmacological action, indications, dosage, contraindications, observations, and energetic aspects.

title: ABEDUL
description: This document describes the medicinal properties and uses of birch (Betula pendula, Betula alba). It covers its active ingredients, pharmacological action, therapeutic indications, toxicity, dosage forms, energetic aspects, and use in traditional Chinese medicine.

title: Calendula
description: This document describes the Calendula flower, also known as Caléndula Officinalis, a member of the Asteráceas family. It covers its medicinal properties, including its antiseptic, antifungal, anti-inflammatory, and healing qualities. The document details its uses for various ailments, both internally and externally, and provides dosage information for different applications.

title: ACHICORIA
description: This document describes the properties and uses of chicory, a plant with the Latin name Cichorium intybus. It highlights its medicinal properties, particularly its diuretic, digestive, and anti-inflammatory effects. The document also details its active ingredients, contraindications, dosage, and energetic aspects according to traditional medicine.

title:
Manzanilla romana –
manzanilla amarga
description: This document describes Manzanilla romana, also known as Manzanilla amarga, including its scientific name (Chamaemelum nobile L.), family (Asteráceas), active ingredients, pharmacological action, indications, dosage, precautions, toxicity, observations, and energetic aspects.

title: Calabazas
description: This document describes the properties and uses of pumpkins, including their Latin name, family, active ingredients, and pharmacological action.
